attributes.action: Block the affiliation fee increase of 1150% for rifle clubs and museums
attributes.background:
The home office is running a review of affiliation fees for rifle clubs and museums holding section 5 firearms.
The fee is currently £84, under the new proposal the fee would increase to £1050; an increase of 1150%.
This would have a massive impact on the 38 museums and 61 clubs requiring this.
attributes.additional_details:
The government have made it an arduous process to respond, requiring a lengthy form to be downloaded, filled, and emailed back. This is likely to significantly reduce the amount of signatories opposed to this proposition.
The official review is here: https://www.gov.uk/government/uploads/system/uploads/attachment_data/file/583035/170110pn_Firearms_Fees_consultation_FINAL.pdf

attributes.action: Give vegans the right to refuse funding the meat industry with their tax money
attributes.background: Veganism is the number one factor in saving the planet, resources, water shortage. Vegans are increasing every day and we feel strongly that our tax is used to fund an industry we find unacceptable. Vegans have the right as Article 9 of the EHRA states, for our views are to be taken seriously.
attributes.additional_details: Recently the new five pound note was found to have tallow in the initial process of manufacture. This has caused outrage not just with vegan groups, the Church but also Muslims. This 'small' problem is now going to be resolved. Why then as vegans in our thousands have we not been given a choice in where our tax money goes. The meat/animal/war industries supported by a huge proportion of our earnings is entirely against our ethics. We therefore wish to question this as it is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Prevent fracking in the village of Marsh Lane and the Town of Eckington
attributes.background: Fracking has been proposed in the area of Eckington. The people of the area do not want fracking to occur due to the damages that are linked to it such as Sink Holes, pollution to the water table, heavy plant traffic on small B roads and the eye-sore that it will cause to the local area.

attributes.action: Regulation of changeover fees charged by caravan site owners
attributes.background: Make it illegal for static caravan site owners to charge a fee in respect of change of ownership of a caravan where the sale is a private sale and the caravan site has had no involvement in the sale. Also to cap the fees charged where the site owner has sold a caravan on behalf of an owner

attributes.action: Irlen Syndrome should be recognised by the NHS.
attributes.background: Irlen Syndrome is more common than heart disease or asthma and affects 15% of the General Public, impacting on all aspects of everyday life. It is a perceptual processing disorder, not an optical problem. It is a problem with the brain's ability to process visual information.

attributes.action: Government to introduce different regulations around indemnity insurance for IM
attributes.background: Due to the current governing body for midwifery (The NMC)stating that current independent midwifery practice indemnity insurance is not sufficient we are asking for the government to introduce different regulations that will provide adequate indemnity insurance for independent midwives.

attributes.action: Amend Exclusionary Rape Law that excludes woman from committing rape
attributes.background: The rape definition uses gendered language ‘he’ and excluding female perpetrators from the legal definition.This excludes victims of female perpetrators by excluding them from official statistics, research, and denies them equal justice and support since sexual assault carried a lesser sentence.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/42/part/1/crossheading/rape/section/1

This definition concerns penetration (penile emphasis) to the exclusion of envelopment (vaginal emphasis)

This breaks the Equality Act 2010, by indirect discrimination
https://www.gov.uk/guidance/equality-act-2010-guidance

Rape is “Forced to have sex against their will” yet a form of this is classed only as sexual assault, carrying a lesser sentence.

http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/2003/42/part/1

attributes.action: Protect our freedom to collect wild food from common land for personal use.
attributes.background: In light of the Forestry commission's unscientific & undemocratic decision to ban fungi picking in the New Forest, against the weight of evidence, we the undersigned demand the government enact legal protections for our rights to forage for personal use as per those detailed in the theft act 1968.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.conservationevidence.com/individual-study/230
25 year longitudinal study, showing mushroom picking has no effect on the fungal ecosystem.

Ref: 'New Forest fungi picking ban "unscientific" say fungi experts'

http://www.foragers-association.org.uk/index.php/press/new-forest-fungi-picking-ban-press-release

swedish model of "everyman's right"

http://www.sverigeturism.se/smorgasbord/smorgasbord/natrecspo/nature/every.html

Theft act: http://www.legislation.gov.uk/ukpga/1968/60/contents

attributes.action: Participate in the UN conference to negotiate a Treaty to ban nuclear weapons.
attributes.background: The conference, which is set to take place in New York with the first session in March 2017, represents a significant opportunity to make real progress towards a worldwide nuclear weapons ban.
attributes.additional_details: Whilst repeatedly claiming to support multilateral nuclear disarmament, successive governments appear to have done very little towards actually bringing it about. The forthcoming United Nations conference is an opportunity for this government to send out a message globally that it is serious about achieving a world free of nuclear weapons.

attributes.action: Don’t Railroad Soho: Save Soho from the CrossRail 2 Scheme
attributes.background: The future of Soho could change dramatically this coming June when we anticipate the transport minister announcing the approval of CrossRail 2. It will allow the demolition of two blocks for a new train station that will bring double the footfall of Kings Cross Underground into and around Soho.
attributes.additional_details:
That’s 270 thousand people every three hour peak right on the corner of Frith Street and Shaftesbury Avenue.  

We do not oppose CrossRail 2.  However, we oppose any decision to include Soho in the scheme.  

I have supported the Save Soho movement since it began and have assisted Tim Arnold and the Save Soho group whenever possible. 

Please join us by signing this petition for yours and our Soho.

Stephen Fry, chairman of Save Soho

attributes.action: To stop supporting Saudi Arabia as they massacre the Yemeni people
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia, backed by Britain, have been launching airstrikes in neighbouring Yemen, the Arab world's poorest country, killing innocent civilians and violating international humanitarian law, and despite horrific human rights abuses, this war has not captured the attention of the Western public.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.fidh.org/en/region/north-africa-middle-east/saudi-arabia/suspend-saudi-arabia-from-the-un-human-rights-council

http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/jeremy-corbyn-accuses-theresa-may-of-sacrificing-human-rights-to-sell-weapons-to-saudi-arabia_uk_584ad43be4b0b7ff851cf979

https://www.theguardian.com/world/2016/sep/24/yemen-britain-human-rights-inquiry

Stop The War On Yemen: https://www.facebook.com/StopTheWarOnYemen/?fref=ts

attributes.action: To save the 16 remaining hospital beds at Okehampton Hospital
attributes.background: The Clinical Commission Group are proposing to remove the 16 remaining hospital beds at Okehampton Hospital. Residents of Okehampton and the surrounding area, urge the retention of our local hospital beds. Okehampton is the hub of a huge rural area with a population of 20,000 people. .
attributes.additional_details:
Okehampton is geographically isolated from East Devon hospitals where beds are retained for non-acute care.
 
The frail and elderly need local pre and post op beds for rehabilitation and nursing care 24/7 and a proper care package before they go home. With poor public transport some friends and families already travel many miles to get to Okehampton.

attributes.action: Equally free GCSE and A Level Exams for Home Educated Children..
attributes.background:
Thousands of UK citizens home educate!  School failed some of these families,  others simply home educate out of personal preference. 

Is it right to disadvantage children educated at zero expense to tax payers? Why then the fees for home educated children to sit GCSEs and A levels?
attributes.additional_details:
For every year I teach my own children, the tax payers save between £3000 and £6000 This is the case for every home educated child. No funding is provided in anyway. I am a single parent and we are a low income family because of our choice, we accept that this will be the case until I have finished teaching the children. 

 However, we do ask  the same free provision of GCSE and A Level examinations  for home educated children,  who should have equal opportunities in this area at the very least.

attributes.action: Investigate the 19 deaths at Orchid View care home
attributes.background: Of the 19 residents who died due to safeguarding failures at Orchid View care home 5 of those deaths were due to neglect. This was stated by the coroner. The families of those five victims, and the other 14 victims, have fought for a Public inquiry.
attributes.additional_details:
Today - October 20th 2016, the families learned from Under Minister David Mowat that their request for a Public Inquiry has been turned down. They remain committed to seeking justice for their lost loved ones, they remain committed to seeking a public inquiry. 
Only 10,000 signatures are needed for the petition to be presented at parliament. Please sign this petition.

attributes.action: Save Bridgnorth and Ludlow Maternity Units
attributes.background: Bridgnorth and Ludlow MLU's  are in danger of becoming birthing units and being closed over night.Please show your support and sign this petition.We need to fight to keep these amazing services open 24 hours a day as they are now.
attributes.additional_details: The CCG and SATH have been challenged regarding plans but no details have been announced yet about how rural maternity services will be funded beyond April 2017,  when the current funding contract ends...Please sign this petition.We have growing support now for all 3 Maternity units: Bridgnorth,Ludlow and Oswestry .We have three campaigns running on Facebook  each with over 1000 members, we have had media interest, gained support from our local town council and will be meeting with our local MP.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum in Scotland to give the country a choice to repeal devolution.
attributes.background:
The Scottish government are failing Scotland by focusing on their pursuit for Scottish Independence over governing the country. 

Give Scotland a chance to dissolve Holyrood and repeal devolution, trusting democratically elected Scotland MP's to represent Scotland in Parliament.

attributes.action: Raise the issue of the Taiji Dolphin slaughters with the Japanese Government
attributes.background: I've been horrified to learn & witness that every year in Taiji,Japan, dolphins are chased into a small cover and butchered in the most horrific and cruel way imaginable. The hunts are subsidized by the dolphin captivity industry,for a few "show quality' dolphins that are ripped from their families.
attributes.additional_details: People across the world have been shocked by this act of cruelty that is live streamed by many welfare organisation to raise awareness, e.g. dolphin project, sea shepherd,racing against extinction etc. This year the order book for Taiji is 150 dolphins for captivity, anymore captured will be killed. The world is watching and speaking out against Taiji but Governments continue to ignore their people. We ask, when will someone in power step forward and end this horrific act before its too late.

attributes.action: Investigate Bayer & Baxter in relation to HIV-infected Factor VIII in the NHS
attributes.background: During the 1980's both Bayer AG and Baxter (Travenol) sold HIV infected Factor Concentrates, which were purchased by the UK Government and the NHS. Their actions have not been investigated by Westminster, not even a refund has been sought. We believe victims and their families deserve the truth.
attributes.additional_details:
1,243 Haemophiliacs were infected with HIV from using contaminated Factor products. Less than 250 remain alive.

Tainted Blood Scandal - https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tainted_blood_scandal_(United_Kingdom)

attributes.action: Remove the EU flag from the UK driving licence.
attributes.background: On 23rd June 2016 the British people voted to Leave the EU. Now MP's have voted to accept the PM's Article 50 bill and triggering the process of leaving is imminent, we petition the Government to order the removal of the EU flag from all newly issued UK driving licenses.
attributes.additional_details: The EU flag as defined by the circle of yellow stars on the rectangular blue background. Once Britain leaves the political Union, this symbol will not only be outdated but will have no place on official documents such as the UK driving license. The symbol, appearing on official government issued documents, signifies the EU’s power over those institutions issuing said documents. Britain leaving the EU means that the EU no longer has any jurisdiction over these British government institutions.

attributes.action: All NHS trusts to offer a minimum of 2 funded fertility treatments.
attributes.background:
We have been struggling with infertilty for the last 6 years, we have had various drugs and one Funded IVF cycle.
We got pregnant with IVF. Our baby boy was born pre-term (18wks) and didn't survive. 
This petition is to help others in a similar circumstance to us, to have another NHS funded cycle.
attributes.additional_details: Not all NHS trusts offer the same amount funded cycles.

attributes.action: Ban disposable plastic crockery and cutlery to help the environment
attributes.background: Recently France became the first country to pass an all-out ban on plastic cutlery, plates, and cups. Let's follow their example through a ban on disposable plastic tableware. These plastics affect our environment and use fossil fuels. Plastic pollution is a pervasive issue but we can change this.
attributes.additional_details:
Plastics are extremely durable, lightweight, cheap and versatile - features which mean that they have replaced many traditional materials such as metal, glass and wood. Unfortunately these features make them the most pervasive, persistent and hazardous form of litter in our environment. 

Furthermore, plastic manufacturing is estimated to use 8 percent of yearly global oil production. This precious resource is being wasted on disposable products for 'convenience'. This is not sustainable.

attributes.action: Save Oswestry Maternity Unit
attributes.background: Oswestry MLU it is in danger of becoming a birthing unit. Add your voice to this petition to keep this unit open full time & keep this amazing service,  vital not only for births in Shropshire & Powys but to keep the amazing ante & post natal care so many of us have been lucky enough to receive.
attributes.additional_details:
Taken from The Shropshire Star:

Fears have been raised because no details have been announced about how rural maternity services such as those at Ludlow, Bridgnorth and Oswestry are to be funded beyond April 2017 when the current funding contract ends.

Shrewsbury and Telford Hospitals NHS Trust, which runs the Ludlow midwife-led unit, insists there are no plans to close it permanently.

However the financial recovery plan for the trust lists one of the possible changes as converting three midwife led units to birthing centres.


Read more at http://www.shropshirestar.com/news/health/2016/12/12/call-for-clarity-over-shropshires-rural-maternity-units/#708l6fDDyjgG1DFp.99

attributes.action: Reject measures in the Digital Economy Bill to censor legal content online
attributes.background: The Digital Economy Bill has passed its third reading in the Commons. It includes measures to force Internet Service Providers to block pornographic websites which don't verify the age of users via intrusive means, and to censor legal content depicting sexual acts classified "non-conventional".
attributes.additional_details:
This amounts to intrusive and dangerous State censorship of legal content online.

While the Government may claim that the aim is solely to protect children from viewing adult content, the reality is that these measures are unnecessary - when ISPs already provide optional filters for such content, bring severe privacy risks, and establish the precedent and framework to allow the Government to censor legal online content of which it simply does not approve.

These measures must be rejected.

attributes.action: Introduce government funding for The Medical Detection Dogs charity.
attributes.background: Dogs can be trained to detect certain cancers in urine samples, quickly, accurately and at less cost to the NHS. They make possible the earlier identification  of some difficult to detect cancers. They can also assist people by alerting them to imminent medical dangers. Yet they receive no funding.
attributes.additional_details: This charity has changed the lives of individuals with diabetes, epilepsy, narcolepsy and serious allergies, by giving them greater security and independence. The Medical Assistance  dogs help their confidence and general well being and in some cases enables them to lead a normal life. The charity saves the NHS more money by reducing the emergency call out incidents. Its worthwhile work could be extended to help many more people, given money and recognition.

attributes.action: Make the reproduction and selling of HM Armed Forces Veteran's Badges illegal.
attributes.background: We the Veteran's of Her Majesty's Armed Forces strongly believe that the buying and selling of the HM Armed Forces Veteran's Badges is both immoral and unjust. It takes away from us the sanctity of the badge itself, and us having earned it.
attributes.additional_details: A great many HM Armed Forces Veterans have expressed both disgust and dismay at the fact that obtaining a Veteran's Badge is as simple as buying one from eBay. We, as Her Majesty's Armed Forces Veteran's have earned the right to wear our badge with honour and pride, whereas charlatans obtain discounts and respect that they DO NOT deserve and have NOT earned. This is completely unacceptable to those of us who have served our country; often at great personal cost, both physically and emotionally.

attributes.action: Make the new GCSEs begin for 2017/18 Year 7 class, and not the current Year 10.
attributes.background: Since Year 7, we have been taught under curriculum supporting the old GCSE system. Now, we are suddenly being forced to suddenly change this, and this means students are already struggling and are less likely to reach their full potential.This is affecting our futures and it needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: A lot of my teachers are unsure what to teach so suddenly with these new specifications. How are we supposed to achieve and excel with even our teachers not being sure on what we need to know? A one to two year gap until it is taught will ensure teachers can prepare properly, rather than a sudden change. Grades 9-1 are hard to distinguish for students, parents, teachers, and even employers. Did they really need to change so suddenly?

attributes.action: Abolish the House of Lords
attributes.background: They are unelected and cost too much money.
attributes.additional_details: I refer to the information provided by the media.

attributes.action: Give a 5 year minimum jail term if convicted of setting up/attending dog fights
attributes.background: A violent and savage example of man manipulating nature to fulfil his own curious bloodlust, dog fighting is rightly banned nearly everywhere in the world. Dog fighting has far from disappeared, in fact it’s a hobby that is distressingly alive and well and appears to be on the increase!
attributes.additional_details:
Dogs forced into fighting suffer terrible injuries, both from the fights and at the hands of their vicious owners. Death, blood and violence is a par for the course in the dog fighting world, compassion or conscience for the ‘losing’ dog is not an issue the average dog-fighter will concern themselves with.

In order to offer a sufficient deterrent I ask that those convicted of arranging/attending dog fights are to be given a mandatory custodial sentence of a minimum 5 years.

attributes.action: Include cats on the reportable accident list like dogs and larger animals.
attributes.background: In less than 2 years I have had 3 cats killed after being hit by cars.  All 3 of my cats have just been left either in the road or at the side of the road and nobody has had the decency to let me know. I think it is about time that accidents involving cats should be reported as is the law with dogs.
attributes.additional_details: By letting the owner know that their beloved pet has been hit could be the difference between the cat surviving or passing away, those few minutes after an accident are crucial and could give the pet owner time to get to the vets and potentially save the cats life! I know this will not bring my cats back and it wont prevent more accidents.  But it would mean not so many people lose their pets if they can get them to the vets in time.

attributes.action: Mandatory in depth training and understanding of SEN  for all teaching staff
attributes.background: Teaching staff are under trained in special educational needs and have a lack of understanding for these children. This impacts not only these children but other children in the school. This downfall in education will follow these children in adulthood in forms of depression. This needs to change
attributes.additional_details: After speaking with parents who have childen with special educational needs in mainstream schools, we all agree our main concern is a lack of in depth training/understanding teachers have in our childrens conditions. This has a negative impact on not only our children but family life and others. We feel we aren't listened to in schools. our children are treated as less important within the school. Some get very little help or like my son who is autistic dyspraxic and dyslexic gets no help at all

attributes.action: save Taylor unit
attributes.background: I am a staff nurse who works on Taylor unit at leigh infirmary. Myself and all the staff are dedicated in the rehabilitation of patients who have suffered head injuries, and other neurological diseases. We have been informed that our unit is to close early next year.
attributes.additional_details: Taylor Unit was opened in 1994, for the people of wigan Bolton salford and leigh.  It is a dedicated neurological rehabilitation unit, offering exceptional care.

attributes.action: Ask Andrea Leadsom to agree to a TOTAL ban on ivory sales including before 1947
attributes.background:
Demand for ivory has seen almost 150,000 elephants lost to poaching in under a decade.
On 21/9/16 Andrea Leadsom announced plans for a ban on sales of modern day ivory, but allowing trade before 1947.
CITES CoP17 taking place in Johannesburg, South Africa from 24 September to 5 October 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
DEFRA will consult on plans for the ban next year. 
Environment Secretary Andrea Leadsom said:
The UK has a strong record as a global leader in the fight against the illegal wildlife trade and I’m determined to do all we can to bring an end to poaching and ivory trafficking.
"To do all that DEFRA can" would be to have a TOTAL ban on ivory sales before and after 1947.
Therefore I call on Andrea Leadsom to plan for a TOTAL ban on all ivory trade in and out of the UK.

attributes.action: To allow every serviceman and woman to have a dignified funeral
attributes.background: Veterans Bereavement Support Services call upon the Government to ensure that veterans who pass away without anyone to deal with their affairs have something more than a pauper’s funeral to recognise their passing. The Government needs to pay for a basic attendance funeral

attributes.action: UK Government Should intervene to stop Rohingya genocide in Burma
attributes.background: Scores of Rohingya Muslims are fleeing to Bangladesh because of a military crackdown in western Myanmar, according to residents and Bangladeshi army officials.
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the Rohingya were shot as they tried to cross the Naaf River that separates Myanmar and Bangladesh, while others arriving by boat were pushed away by Bangladeshi border guards, residents quoted by Reuters news agency said on Wednesday.



A total of 130 people have been killed in the latest surge of violence in the country, according to the Myanmar army.
The bloodshed is the most serious since thousands were killed in communal clashes in the western Myanmar state of Rakhine since 2012.

attributes.action: NHS to lower smear test age to 18
attributes.background: I believe that the NHS should lower the smear test age to 18: After so many scary stories of young women suffering from cervical cancer. Women are being refused smear test due to being younger than 25.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.google.co.uk/amp/www.mirror.co.uk/news/uk-news/cervical-cancer-victim-dies-aged-9607214.amp?client=safari 

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/health/article-2767864/My-daughter-died-cervical-cancer-visiting-doctors-NINE-times-Mother-s-campaign-lower-smear-test-age-22-year-old-told-young-screening.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-2588651/Mother-tragic-model-19-died-cervical-cancer-tells-heartache-doctors-refusal-daughter-smear-test.html

attributes.action: Make 8 weeks scans routine during pregnancy in addition to 12 & 20 weeks.
attributes.background: We experienced a missed miscarriage that wasn't picked up until our routine 12 weeks scan. Our baby had stopped developing 2 months previous at 5 weeks. Because the pregnancy had gone on so long I had to have surgical management which required a general anaesthetic and a overnight stay in hospital.
attributes.additional_details: Other developed countries offer routine scans at 8 weeks to pick up any concerns as early as possible. Why don't we have this in the UK? Recent studies show 45% of women who have had a miscarriage show signs of PTSD. When 20-25% of pregnancies end in miscarriage and up to 75% are in 1st trimester, earlier precautions should be essential. Because our pregnancy was so advanced I had to have a surgical miscarriage under general anaesthetic. The US and Australia offer 8 week scans and so should we.

attributes.action: Reverse the unfair changes to the State Pension Age imposed on 1950's women.
attributes.background: Thousands of women born in the 1950's expected to receive their State Pension when they reached 60 and planned accordingly. The speed at which the SP changes were introduced and for many with little or no notice has deprived them of their rightful pension. Our SP was earned - it is not a benefit.

attributes.action: Relevant services must come together to prevent lives lost in open water yearly.
attributes.background: One 2011 July day my son Dylan went swimming at a local quarry; 20 minutes in he got into difficulty, unable to swim the short distance to safety. He reportedly died from cold water shock which has 4 stages; probably in the last stage when everything that has fought to stay alive relaxes.
attributes.additional_details: A minute earlier Dylan's rescuer could have saved his life. Currently the UK has nothing in place to prevent these needless deaths. Schools don't educate about the dangers in & around open water & there is no funding in place for prevention. Since Dylan died there has been another 2000 water related deaths. I want Dylan’s death to serve a purpose rather than for him to have died in vain. I want people to live because Dylan died.  We need change and we need it  now!

attributes.action: ban the use of prong and shock collars for dogs within the UK.
attributes.background: Prong and shock collars can cause psychological and physical harm to dogs even when correctly used and can even precipitate aggression in the animal. At present there is no legislation restricting their use and anyone can apply them to any dog.
attributes.additional_details: Many so called trainers many with few or no qualifications use them and get obedience because the dog is terrified of the pain and distress caused rather than because it has been well trained. Alternative methods are effective  see site https://positively.com/dog-training/methods-equipment/training-equipment/choke-and-prong-collars/ for details of the injuries caused by these devices

attributes.action: UK should follow Donald Trump's policy and also put temporary travel ban
attributes.background: UK government should copy Donald Trump's policy and also impose a temporary travel ban on Syria, Lybia, Sudan, Yemen, Somalia, Iran and Iraq.

attributes.action: Fight for funding for an effective coastal defence scheme
attributes.background: The surge of December 2013 resulted in devastation and suffering for all the communities of Walcott, Bacton & Happisburgh. Many losses were catastrophic.Walcott and Bacton have been flooded twice, now, in seven years.
attributes.additional_details: Norman Lamb MP has been an ardent campaigner, supporting us and as a result of his support we achieved partial rock armouring at Ostend, Walcott. Following a meeting with him on Tuesday 30th August 2016, he has asked that I urge everyone in the communities whether you are a resident, a regular visitor, a business or holiday home owner to please sign this petition. The more evidential support we can show the government the better it will be for us all in securing extra funding towards a beneficial defence scheme.

attributes.action: Allow safe spaces for rough sleepers to camp
attributes.background: I have worked with homeless people who have been badly treated and ended up in dangerous situations sleeping on the streets. None asked to end up in this situation. Nobody asked to be beaten or spat at or to become ill due to the freezing temperatures. Safe camp sites to help temporarily.
attributes.additional_details: Statistics are rising and people are becoming even more vulnerable. Safe camp sites will allow people to commune to support each other, protect each other and have minor shelter from a tent. If this was legal there would be less crisis on the streets as support agencies will be able to access a larger volume of people and the vulnerable can get the help they require. This could also improve many social factors. Those with no homes should not be punished for looking for somewhere safe to sleep!!

attributes.action: Have an independent investigation into BBC Impartiality & Neutrality
attributes.background: The BBC Claims to be neutral and impartial. The Left claim it is very right-wing, the Right claim it is very left-wing. BBC Reluctant to investigate itself and is arrogant when suggested that it is not impartial.
attributes.additional_details: The BBC seem reluctant to investigate themselves, and they appear arrogant when suggested that they are not impartial. But some went to the same schools and universities as politicians they may be involved with, or even members of the same clubs. This is why the investigation needs to be by somebody who would not let this influence them.

attributes.action: Allow Scotland's emergency services to be VAT exempt just like others in the UK
attributes.background: The UK Government has refused to allow Scotland's newly formed Emergency services to be tax exempt which is the case for the rest of the UK's Emergency services. This is wrong and unjust a d needs to end immediately.
attributes.additional_details:
Millions are wasted by Police Scotland being unable to claim back VAT as other Police and fire services do.
It's completely illogical and unjust that Scotland should be forced to pay VAT without being able to reclaim it.

attributes.action: To teach UK pupils how food choices impact the environment
attributes.background:
No other single activity has a bigger impact on the planet than the raising of livestock for meat, milk and eggs.

By adding to the school curriculum we can introduce positive environmental change by educating pupils of how their buying behaviour and food choices effect the world we live in.
attributes.additional_details: http://science.time.com/2013/12/16/the-triple-whopper-environmental-impact-of-global-meat-production/

attributes.action: We want RM stonehouse to be kept open it's the  spiritual home and HQ for RM
attributes.background: The government  recently announced that Stonehouse was being put up for sale. Stonehouse is the spiritual embodiment of the Royal Marines  and three commando Brigade is the Royal marines home  and shouldn't be sold for housing it is a listed building that has a lots of heart and history.
attributes.additional_details:
The earliest parts of Stonehouse Barracks date from 1756 The buildings immediately became the headquarters of the Plymouth Division of the Royal Marines. Although the divisional structure of the Royal Marines was dismantled during the Second World War, the barracks remain in use as headquarters of 3 Commando Brigade. 
It is also home to the globe theatre a beautiful music hall. 
As a whole, Stonehouse is described as "the oldest and most important group of barracks in England not forming part of a fortification, a very rare example of C18 planning, and a complex of great historic value

attributes.action: Reinstate tax credits for those who have claims stopped by concentrix.
attributes.background: As many are aware, concentrix have cancelled many people's claims for tax credits forcing many people to live under there means, for weeks and sometimes even months. This is disgusting & needs to be fixed ASAP. We need money to survive.

attributes.action: Stop sales of arms to Saudi Arabia until there are no human rights concerns
attributes.background: Saudi Arabia has bought 1000's of missiles and bombs in recent years and more contracts for arms have been approved. British made weapons may now be in use in the conflict in Yemen. Saudi is on the list of countries the British Foreign office thinks are of human rights concern.

attributes.action: Make bereavement training mandatory for all midwives and maternity care staff
attributes.background: 17 babies are either stillborn or die a neonatal death every single day in the United Kingdom. Despite this shocking statistic, many hospitals remain ill prepared to deal with these events. Staff often receive little or no bereavement training and facilities are inadequate.
attributes.additional_details: There are more than 3600 stillbirths every year in the UK, and one in every 200 births ends in a stillbirth. Eleven babies are stillborn every day in the UK, making it 15 times more common than cot death. Many midwives have never received bereavement training. We have helped produce an e-learning course for the RCM which would give very basic training free of charge to the 33,000 RCM Members however only 1073 have registered, with 575 completing the course so far!

attributes.action: Fund care homes exclusively for vegetarians and vegans.
attributes.background: Vegetarians, mainly Hindus have strict vegetarian dietary needs which are not available in any care home facilities provided by the Government.
attributes.additional_details:
Our research has shown there is not a single care home manged by the Government that funds catering for the needs of Hindu Vegetarians.

Private care homes are beyond the reach of 90% of the Hindus hence it is a moral obligation on the part of the Government to cater for the needs of the Hindu Community and other Vegetarians. 

The National Congress of Gujarati Organisations UK, the largest Hindu Organisation in the UK with 860,000 plus members, has requested this petition.
attributes.creator_name: Chandrakant J ivraj Rabheru President of NCGO
